title: Position​
content: </> ProximityPromptZS.Position: Vector3?  The position of the prompt.

title: Part​
content: </> ProximityPromptZS.Part: BasePart?  A part which determines the position of the prompt.

title: Range​
content: </> ProximityPromptZS.Range: number Distance within which the prompt will be visible.

title: Obstructable​
content: </> ProximityPromptZS.Obstructable: boolean Whether or not line-of-sight is required to see the prompt. Instances in ProximityPromptZS.ObstructionIgnoreList will not block line-of-sight.

title: ObstructionIgnoreList​
content: </> ProximityPromptZS.ObstructionIgnoreList: {Instance } Instances which will be ignored when checking for obstruction.

title: HoldTime​
content: </> ProximityPromptZS.HoldTime: number Time required to hold interact on the prompt to trigger it.

title: ActionText​
content: </> ProximityPromptZS.ActionText: string Text displayed on the UI which represents the action being performed.

title: ObjectText​
content: </> ProximityPromptZS.ObjectText: string Text displayed on the UI which represents the object being acted on.

title: Enabled​
content: </> ProximityPromptZS.Enabled: boolean Whether or not the prompt is enabled for interaction.

title: Triggered​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only Signal </> ProximityPromptZS.Triggered: Signal Fired when a player triggeres the prompt.

title: InteractBegan​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only Signal </> ProximityPromptZS.InteractBegan: Signal Fired when a player starts using the prompt.

title: InteractEnded​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only Signal </> ProximityPromptZS.InteractEnded: Signal Fired when a player stops using the prompt.

title: new​
content: </> ProximityPromptZS.new( propertyTable: ProximityPromptProperties,-- The initial values of prompt properties identifier: string? ) → ProximityPromptZS Create a new proximity prompt. warning There are some properties in propertyTable which must be defined. You must define either Part or Position. ActionText and ObjectText must be defined.

title: Destroy​
content: </> ProximityPromptZS:Destroy() → () Destroy the prompt

title: Type​
content: </> Objective.Type: string Type of "kill", "find", "collect", "interact", or "money".

title: Text​
content: </> Objective.Text: string Text for the objective which will display in UI.

title: IsPrimary​
content: </> Objective.IsPrimary: boolean Shows the objective as having priority in UI.

title: MarkerMap​
content: </> Objective.MarkerMap: Folder?  A folder of nodes which will be used to guide the player towards Objective.Location.

title: MarkerPositions​
content: </> Objective.MarkerPositions: Vector3 | {Vector3 }? Points to place markers for the objective.

title: MarkerParts​
content: </> Objective.MarkerParts: BasePart | {BasePart }? Parts to attach objective markers to.

title: Location​
content: </> Objective.Location: Vector3?  The objective location for single goal type objectives. Makes use of MarkerMap to guide the player towards the goal using pathfinding generated markers.

title: Progress​
content: </> Objective.Progress: number? The current progress for the objective displayed in UI.

title: ProgressTotal​
content: </> Objective.ProgressTotal: number? The target progress for the objective displayed in UI.

title: TargetPlayers​
content: </> Objective.TargetPlayers: {Player }? An array of players which will be given the objective.

title: ImageID​
content: </> Objective.ImageID: string? An image ID which will replace the objective type's icon in UI.

title: AccentColor​
content: </> Objective.AccentColor: Color3?  Overrides the objective type's accent color in UI.

title: ProgressFormat​
content: </> Objective.ProgressFormat: string? Overrides the objective type's progress format. For a reference on how to use format strings, see format strings. The format string will be used like so: string:format(progress, progressTotal).

title: new​
content: </> Objective.new( propertyTable: ObjectiveProperties,-- A table containing initialization values for properties identifier: string?-- Internal use ) → Objective Create a new objective object. warning You must define Type and Text in propertyTable.

title: AddMarker​
content: </> Objective:AddMarker(location: Vector3 | BasePart ) → string Add a new marker on the HUD with the objective's identifier.

title: AddMarkers​
content: </> Objective:AddMarkers(locations: Vector3 | {Vector3 } | {BasePart }) → () Add markers from vector3s or BaseParts.

title: AppendPlayer​
content: This item only works when running on the server. Server </> Objective:AppendPlayer(appendingPlayer: Player ) → () Includes an additional player in Objective.TargetPlayers.

title: Destroy​
content: </> Objective:Destroy(wasCompleted: boolean?) → () Destroy the objective.

title: Remove​
content: </> Objective:Remove() → () Remove the objective (same as objective:Destroy).

title: Complete​
content: </> Objective:Complete() → () Remove the objective and show completion UI.
